text:
It appears to be possible to invoke a servlet's init method multiple times. The 
example we have found that does this is the following;

1) Servlet container started and "myservlet" loaded on startup via the 
load-on-startup directive in the web.xml file. This works fine.

2) Servlet is then invoked via a jsp page through a form call that references as 
an action

mysite.com/servlet/myservlet

Upon this call, servlet re-initializes. That is the init method runs again.

Contrary to prior bug reports I have seen referring to this nature, we do not 
find that this reinitialization occurs only if the servlet is called before it 
completes processing of the first call to the init method.

text:
Can you attach a small WAR file so we can reproduce the problem ? It would help 
a lot in fixing it. I'm also not sure it's a bug ( need to see the web.xml and 
the jsp ), the invoker is not clearly defined and it is very possible ( and may
be ok from spec point of view - since the invoker is not defined ) to treat the 
/servlet/myservlet as a new ( different ) servlet ( strange - the code checks
for an existing servlet with the name ).

The problem is that 2 servlets are used - one defined explicitely and one 
by the invoker. This is not a bug ( except the fact that the invoker is not 
defined in the spec )

creator: bora123@yahoo.com

text:
Ok, Now I got it.

In this case, instead of calling servlets with their actual class names, we 
will use the the value given by <servlet-name></servlet-name> to prevent it 
from reinitializing. Calling servlets by their actual class names will reinvoke 
them by disregarding the one alrady loaded by LoadOnStartUp interceptor.

sorry for the spam, it was in fact invalid.
